citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee has a program of veterinary care for the rabbits, hedgehog and chinchilla, but when they contacted the
veterinary office they stated they no longer wished to be the attending veterinarian.
Each dealer or exhibitor shall have an attending veterinarian who shall provide adequate veterinary care to its animals.
Ensure that a veterinarian is willing to provide veterinary care to the rabbits, chinchilla, and hedgehog.
To be corrected by January 31, 2023

The facility acquired a hedgehog and they do not have any record of where the hedgehog came from.
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the name and address
of all animals acquired.
Ensure that records are made, and maintained to allow animals to be traced and tracked in the event of animal disease
outbreak, and to ensure all persons who are required to be licensed have a current and valid license.
To be corrected from this day forward January 17, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Park Manager/Zookeeper.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee has a program of veterinary care for the rabbits, hedgehog and chinchilla, but when they contacted the 
veterinary office they stated they no longer wished to be the attending veterinarian. 
Each dealer or exhibitor shall have an attending veterinarian who shall provide adequate veterinary care to its animals. 
Ensure that a veterinarian is willing to provide veterinary care to the rabbits, chinchilla, and hedgehog. 
 
To be corrected by January 31, 2023 
2.75(b)(1)(i) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility acquired a hedgehog and they do not have any record of where the hedgehog came from. 
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the name and address 
of all animals acquired. 
Ensure that records are made, and maintained to allow animals to be traced and tracked in the event of animal disease 
outbreak, and to ensure all persons who are required to be licensed have a current and valid license. 
 
To be corrected from this day forward January 17, 2023

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Park Manager/Zookeeper. 
 
End Section
